channel.title: Times of India

item.title: FM to investors in US: Don’t go by perceptions about India, come & see
item.description: Launching a scathing attack on the negative western “perceptions being built” about India, finance minister Nirmala Sithraman has said the Muslim population in India has been growing since Independence and the country has the second-largest Muslim population in the world while in Pakistan religious minorities have been decimated. “Those talking about perception should know that Muslim population in India has not dwindled between 2014 and 2023,” said the FM while taking part in a discussion.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: SC: Invoking NSA in cases of political nature abuse of law
item.dc:creator: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY

item.title: Karnataka assembly elections: BSY’s son in BJP’s first list of 189
item.description: The BJP released Tuesday its first list of 189 candidates for the May 10 assembly polls in Karnataka, fielding party veteran and former chief minister BS Yediyurappa’s son BY Vijayendra from the Shikaripura constituency in Shivamogga, the same seat his father has won seven times since 1983.
item.dc:creator: MANU AIYAPPA AND SANDEEP MOUDGAL

item.title: More bowlers should try run-outs at their end: Ashwin
item.description: When Ravichandran Ashwin ran Jos Butler out at the bowler’s end in the 2018 IPL, it created a lot of controversy. Five years down the line, the ‘cheating tag’ to that form of dismissal has been diluted significantly and the term ‘Mankading’ has gone out from cricketing vocabulary.
item.dc:creator: DWAIPAYAN DATTA

item.title: Rohit Sharma relieved after Mumbai Indians' first win
item.description: After two defeats to open their IPL 2023 season, Mumbai Indians heaved a sigh of relief after a tense last-ball win over Delhi Capitals at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: India rejects China’s objections to Amit Shah’s Arunachal visit
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Defiant Pilot goes on fast, draws no action from Cong brass
item.dc:creator: JOYCHEN JOSEPH AND AJAY SINGH

item.title: Teach Natyashastra, Panini in school, says draft NCF
item.description: The draft NCF-2023 recommends a ‘Bharatiya’ curriculum, including study of ancient Indian texts like Natyashastra, Abhinaya Darpanam and Vaastushastra besides the works of mathematicians like Baudhayana, Panini and Pingala and exploring India’s major scientific discoveries.
item.dc:creator: MANASH PRATIM GOHAIN

item.title: Monsoon likely to be ‘normal’ at 96% despite El Nino conditions: IMD
item.description: A day after private weather forecaster Skymet predicted a “below normal” monsoon this year in India, the IMD on Tuesday said it’s likely to be “normal”, with a 49% probability of “normal to above normal” rainfall during the June-September period.
item.dc:creator: VISHWA MOHAN

item.title: With no vaccine production due to low demand, states’ stocks run dry
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: IMF cuts GDP growth forecast to 5.9%
item.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday cut India's GDP growth forecast to 5.9% for 2023-24. This is the lowest estimate among the multilateral agencies and the first below 6% projection.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Data Protection Bill ready, to be tabled in Parliameny in July: AG to SC
item.dc:creator: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA

item.title: 100 feared killed in airstrike on Myanmar village
item.description: Airstrikes by Myanmar's military on Tuesday killed as many as 100 people, including many children, who were attending a ceremony in a village held by opponents of army rule, said a witness, a member of a local pro-democracy group and independent media.
item.dc:creator: NYT News Service

item.title: Addict killed at rehab centre
item.description: On Tuesday morning, the body of a 24-year-old man was flung out of a car by staffers of a drug rehabilitation centre where he had been admitted last month and dumped in front of his house here. Police believe Siddharth Berlan was beaten to death on Monday by the same people who had pledged to cure him of his addiction
item.dc:creator: KALYAN DAS

item.title: LIC ups stakes in 4 Adani companies
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Bengalurean beaten to death in fight over dog poop
item.description: A 68-year-old man was beaten to death for objecting to a couple and a dog trainer letting their pets defecate in front of his residence in northwest Bengaluru.
item.dc:creator: RAJIV KALKOD

item.title: In last 10 years, IMD's 1st forecasts were off by 6.9%

item.title: Orthodox Church head backs PM Modi's government
item.description: The Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church is "not uncomfortable" with the Modi government, its supreme head, Baselios Marthoma Mathews III, has said. He, however, said the situation was not the same for other Christian denominations.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: UK PIO given 18 weeks in prison for caste hate crime
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Ex-Maha CM meets Sharad Pawar amid talk of rift in MVA
item.description: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray met NCP president Sharad Pawar on Tuesday evening at the latter's Silver Oak residence in South Mumbai.
item.dc:creator: CHAITANYA MARPAKWAR

item.title: Brace for jail: Delhi CM Kejriwal to AAP workers
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Communal clashes in Chhattisgarh: Dad, son found dead
item.description: A father and son were found dead Tuesday near Chhattisgarh's Biranpur village, the epicentre of communal violence since Saturday.
item.dc:creator: TNN

item.title: Twitter no longer an independent company, becomes X Corp
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg

item.title: IPL: Rohit shines in MI's thrilling last-ball win
item.description: When Rohit Sharma disdainfully pulls a delivery of sheer pace from Anrich Nortje deep into the mid-wicket stands you know that he is batting at peak of his prowess. For most part of the reply to Delhi Capitals’s 172 at the Ferozeshah Kotla on Tuesday night, it seemed Rohit’s intimidating 45-ball 65 had set up a rather comfortable chase till Nortje turned up for the last over of the match defending just five against power-hitters Cameron Green and Tim David. After facing six near-perfect yorkers hurled at them, David and Green’s long limbs helped them scamper back for two runs off the final ball with six wickets to spare.
item.dc:creator: ARANI BASU

item.title: Why IMD's monsoon forecast is good news for India
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: In pivot beyond China, Cook to open first Apple stores in India
item.description: Apple's CEO, Tim Cook, is set to visit India to formally open its first stores in the country: one in Mumbai, the financial and political capital, on 18 April, and the other in Delhi, the country's capital, on 20 April. These stores have a long history of development, since India's strict rules stipulate that global brands cannot open their own brand outlets unless a significant portion of the merchandise is produced in India. With India being the world's second-largest smartphone market and among the fastest-growing, Apple is betting on India for a growth market and manufacturing base.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg

item.title: Adani rout has retail India investors snapping up group’s stocks
item.description: Retail investors in India have increased their holdings in eight of the 10 companies related to Adani group to correct sky-high valuations. The move came after Hindenburg Research made allegations of accounting fraud and share price manipulation against the group last January.
item.dc:creator: Bloomberg

item.title: BJP can't stop me from representing people of Wayanad: Rahul
item.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said the BJP can never stop him from representing the people of Wayanad.The former Congress chief was in Wayanad for the first time after being disqualified as a member of Parliament from this constituency following his conviction in a defamation case. "The BJP can take away the tag of MP, the post, the house, can jail me, but can't stop me representing people of Wayanad," Rahul Gandhi told a gathering of supporters after holding a road show.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: Due to political war, Amul may enter B'luru market after polls
item.description: With Amul's planned foray into the Bengaluru market snowballing into a huge controversy, sources claim that the dairy major's rollout in the city is likely to be postponed, given that the political slugfest over the issue carries the potential to singe the BJP in the forthcoming assembly elections in the state.
item.dc:creator: B V SHIVA SHANKAR

item.title: WATCH: Warner fancies right-handed batting on a free-hit delivery
item.description: Seasoned Australian opener David Warner on Tuesday grabbed eyeballs when he switched his stance to bat right-handed on a free-hit delivery during an Indian Premier League (IPL) match against Mumbai Indians at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: Centre flays China for objecting to Shah's Arunachal visit
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: IMF lowers India's growth projection to 5.9% for current fiscal
item.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday lowered India's economic growth projection for the current fiscal to 5.9 per cent from 6.1 per cent earlier. Yet India will continue to be the fastest-growing economy in the world.In its annual World Economic Outlook, IMF also lowered the forecast for 2024-25 fiscal (April 2024 to March 2025) to 6.3 per cent from the 6.8 per cent it had predicted in January this year.
item.dc:creator: PTI

item.title: Amritpal Singh’s close aide Papalpreet taken to Assam
item.description: A day after his arrest, Papalpreet Singh, a close aide of fugitive pro-Khalistan sympathiser Amritpal Singh, was flown from Amritsar to Assam’s Dibrugarh where he would be lodged in Central Jail.
item.dc:creator: YUDHVIR RANA

item.title: Barmer admin put on alert after 70 fall ill: Health dept official
item.description: The Barmer district administration in Rajasthan has been put on alert after more than 70 people fell ill, likely due to a viral disease, a health department official said on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM

item.title: UP cops charge man with drowning a rat in drain
item.description: Police in UP have filed a chargesheet against the 30-year-old man from Budaun who was accused of allegedly killing a rat by tying it to a brick and drowning it in a drain last November.
item.dc:creator: KANWARDEEP SINGH

item.title: IMD predicts 'normal rainfall' for this monsoon
item.description: In a respite for the agricultural sector, the government on Tuesday said "normal rain" is likely in many parts of peninsular region, adjoining eastern, northeastern regions and some parts of northwest India. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday predicted "normal to below-normal rainfall" over parts of northwest India, west, central and northeast regions during southwest monsoon, a day after private weather forecaster Skymet predicted likewise.
item.dc:creator: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
